thread.title: TTI Success Insights Named Semi-Finalist for Spirit of Enterprise Award
thread.title_full: TTI Success Insights Named Semi-Finalist for Spirit of Enterprise Award - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: TTI Success Insights Named Semi-Finalist for Spirit of Enterprise Award
text:
Arizona State University’s W.P. Carey School of Business has named TTI Success Insights (TTI SI) as a semi-finalist for its annual Spirit of Enterprise Awards in the category of Social Impact.
Scottsdale, Ariz. (PRWEB) September 30, 2015
Recognizing local leaders in the field of entrepreneurship, Arizona State University’s W.P. Carey School of Business has named TTI Success Insights (TTI SI) as a semi-finalist for its annual Spirit of Enterprise Awards in the category of Social Impact.
To qualify for the Social Impact Award, local businesses had to showcase a demonstrated impact on giving back to the community as a core part of business operations. This spring, TTI SI launched its 100K Lives Touched campaign . The campaign's goal is to make a positive impact by donating the use of assessments to 100,000 individuals in need and in underserved communities. These complimentary assessments are being delivered by TTI’s network of Value Added Associates and are at use in non-profits, in families and in outreach organizations around the globe.
TTI SI Chairman and Founder Bill J. Bonnstetter and Vice President of Corporate Communication Emily Soccorsy recently presented to the judging panel at Arizona State University and shared the company’s story and vision for positively impacting others.
“Not all people or organizations have the means to better understand themselves and others and thus to positively impact our decision-making and achieve true growth,” Bonnstetter said. “We are very proud of our ongoing efforts to make people and organizations more self-aware, and more productive and impactful. With over 150 VAAs in Arizona, many of whom donate their time to organizations and people lacking resources, we are making an impact right in our own backyard.”
In one local example of the 100K Lives Touched campaign, two associates annually donate assessments and their time to high school students, with the belief that teens who discover more about themselves during high school will build confidence and set the stage for better college and career planning. The Fountain Hills duo helps students look at career planning from a new perspective to determine overall job fit for the future.
The 19th annual Spirit of Enterprise Awards ceremony takes place Friday, Nov. 20 at the JW Marriott Phoenix Desert Ridge Resort & Spa, where finalists and semi-finalists will be recognized for their innovative business contributions that have positively impacted the local economy. Visit wpcarey.asu.edu/research/entrepreneurship/soe-event for more event information.
About TTI Success Insights
TTI Success Insights believes all people are unique and have talents and skills of which they are often unaware. We exist to reveal and harness these talents, using the Science of Self. For over 30 years, we have researched and applied social and brain science, creating assessment solutions consultants in 90 countries and 40 languages use to hire, develop and retain the best talent in the world. With a tenacious, innovative culture, we transform potential to productivity, performance and profits. Every 7 seconds, someone is taking a TTI SI assessment report to increase their self-awareness and grow their career. For more information, visit http://www.ttisi.com and @TTI_SI.
